title: (x) Morning Burst italic sans - Ocean Sans {Nick Cooke}
content:
Can anyone figure out what font this is?  
much appreciated :)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012054400/http:/typophile.com/files/font_72.jpg) | 36.36 KB |

 [‹ (x) slab serif in Vogue Men's fall 2005 premier issue - Sutro {Irène Ellenberger}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012054400/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34133 "Go to previous forum topic") [Wire Magazine spreads designed by Nonformat ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012054400/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33281 "Go to next forum topic")
author: fsamuel

comments.content: not a clue, but could you make that sample any smaller?
i know its tiny... ill try to find a bigger version

\> Optima Extra Black Italic?  
No. Not Legacy Sans either.
Could almost be Stone Sans or Myriad, but that “g” throws it.
The closest one is Optima Bold Italic, but the S is off a little

Could be Ocean Sans.

Nick Cooke

Ocean Sans Bold Italic, but with a (too small) round i dot instead of the diamond.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012054400im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/MB_3733.jpg)

Nick Cooke

Yes, Nick. Looks like it.  
But the rest in your sample seems to be Optima.

I know that - It’s the ’Morning Burst’ we’re looking at.

Nick Cooke

Hey Yves - Don’t I get a credit? I love to see my name in brackets ;^D

Nick Cooke
